page.title: 08THURNHAM PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: This school is a Church of England controlled school taking 220 pupils aged 5-7. There are 8 female staff, including a non-teaching head. The school house, built in 1872 contains a hall used for assemblies and dinners, a staff room and an office. The classrooms are either hutted, wooden buildings or mobiles with a mobile lavatory block. The only playground is Tarmac covered. The only grass available is a small area lent by the neighbouring golf club. The school is in an isolated position on the edge of the centre of population and the narrow road makes vehicular access difficult and dangerous. A new school on a different site next to the junior school has been proposed since 1972 but government finance has never allowed it.
